chart_metadata.name: sftpgo
chart_metadata.description: SFTPGo is a fully featured and highly configurable SFTP server with optional HTTP/S, FTP/S and WebDAV support - S3, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob

runAsContext.description: SFTPGo can run as any non-root user.

groups.name: User and Group Configuration
groups.description: Configure User and Group for SFTPGo

attrs.label: CPU
attrs.description: CPU limit for SFTPGo.

schema.valid_chars_error:
Valid CPU limit formats are</br>
- Plain Integer - eg. 1</br>
- Float - eg. 0.5</br>
- Milicpu - eg. 500m

attrs.label: Memory
attrs.description: Memory limit for SFTPGo.

schema.valid_chars_error:
Valid Memory limit formats are</br>
- Suffixed with E/P/T/G/M/K - eg. 1G</br>
- Suffixed with Ei/Pi/Ti/Gi/Mi/Ki - eg. 1Gi</br>
- Plain Integer in bytes - eg. 1024</br>
- Exponent - eg. 134e6

1.2.5.app_readme:
SFTPGo

SFTPGo is a fully featured and highly configurable SFTP server with optional HTTP/S, FTP/S and WebDAV support - S3, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob

When application is installed, a container will be launched with root privileges. This is required in order to apply the correct permissions to the SFTPGo directories. Afterward, the SFTPGo container will run as a non-root user (Default: 568). All mounted storage(s) will be chowned only if the parent directory does not match the configured user.
1.2.5.detailed_readme:
SFTPGo

SFTPGo is a fully featured and highly configurable SFTP server with optional HTTP/S, FTP/S and WebDAV support - S3, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob

When application is installed, a container will be launched with root privileges. This is required in order to apply the correct permissions to the SFTPGo directories. Afterward, the SFTPGo container will run as a non-root user (Default: 568). All mounted storage(s) will be chowned only if the parent directory does not match the configured user.
